seo.title: Pirsch Analytics Alternative: Why Teams Choose OpenPanel
seo.description: Compare OpenPanel vs Pirsch Analytics. Discover why teams choose OpenPanel as their Pirsch alternative for product analytics, user identification, and free self-hosting without enterprise pricing.

hero.heading: Pirsch Alternative
hero.subheading: Love Pirsch's German privacy focus and developer-friendly approach? OpenPanel adds product analytics capabilities - funnels, cohorts, retention, and user identification - plus free self-hosting without enterprise pricing.

competitor.name: Pirsch Analytics
competitor.short_description: Privacy-focused web analytics with strong German hosting, developer-friendly features, and agency-focused capabilities.

summary_comparison.title: OpenPanel vs Pirsch: Which is right for you?
summary_comparison.intro: Both are privacy-focused analytics tools. Pirsch focuses on affordable web analytics with agency features. OpenPanel adds product analytics with user identification.
summary_comparison.one_liner: Pirsch excels at affordable web analytics with excellent white-labeling; OpenPanel adds product analytics with free self-hosting.
best_for_openpanel: SaaS products needing user-level analytics and retention tracking
Teams wanting free self-hosting without Enterprise license fees
Startups needing a permanent free tier (10K events/month)
Mobile app developers needing native iOS, Android, React Native SDKs
best_for_competitor: Agencies managing many client websites with white-labeling needs

highlights.title: Key differences at a glance
highlights.intro: Here's how OpenPanel and Pirsch compare on key factors.

items.label: Analytics Depth
items.notes: OpenPanel combines web analytics with full product analytics including retention, cohorts, and user profiles. Pirsch focuses on web analytics with funnels and A/B testing on higher tiers.

items.label: Free Self-Hosting
items.notes: OpenPanel offers free self-hosting in a single Docker container. Pirsch requires an Enterprise license with custom pricing for on-premise deployment.

items.label: Free Tier
items.notes: OpenPanel offers a generous free tier. Pirsch has no free tier - just a 30-day trial before requiring a $6/month minimum subscription.

items.label: User Identification
items.notes: OpenPanel lets you identify and track individual users across sessions. Pirsch uses daily fingerprinting and doesn't track individuals.

items.label: Server-Side Integration
items.notes: Both offer strong server-side integration. Pirsch was originally built as a Go library for backend tracking, avoiding ad blockers.

feature_comparison.title: Feature comparison
feature_comparison.intro: Both are developer-friendly with privacy focus, but different in depth and pricing.

features.name: Traffic Sources
features.notes: Both track referrers and UTM parameters

features.name: Custom Event Tracking
features.notes: Pirsch supports events with custom metadata

features.name: Funnel Analysis
features.notes: Pirsch funnels require Plus plan ($12/month)

features.name: Retention Analysis
features.notes: Pirsch's anonymous model doesn't support retention

features.name: User Profiles
features.notes: Pirsch doesn't track individual users

features.name: Cohort Analysis
features.notes: Pirsch provides aggregate data only

features.name: Session Replay
features.notes: Pirsch has session analysis (not full replay)

features.name: A/B Testing
features.notes: Pirsch A/B testing requires Plus plan

features.name: Conversion Goals
features.notes: Both support conversion tracking

features.name: Email Reports
features.notes: Both offer scheduled email reports

features.name: Dashboard Sharing
features.notes: Both support public and private sharing

features.name: Google Analytics Import
features.notes: Pirsch has a GA import tool

features.name: URL Shortener
features.notes: Pirsch has built-in URL shortener with tracking

features.name: Cookie-Free by Default
features.notes: Both are cookieless by default

features.name: No Consent Banner Required
features.notes: Both claim no consent needed for basic analytics

features.name: GDPR Compliant
features.notes: Pirsch is hosted in Germany with strict EU compliance

features.name: Schrems II Compliant
features.notes: Pirsch emphasizes Schrems II compliance

features.name: Self-Hosting Option
features.notes: Pirsch self-hosting requires Enterprise license

features.name: Open Source Core
features.notes: Both have open source cores (Pirsch MIT, OpenPanel open source)

features.name: REST API
features.notes: Pirsch has comprehensive RESTful API

features.name: Google Search Console
features.notes: Pirsch has GSC integration in dashboard

features.name: WordPress Plugin
features.notes: Both have WordPress plugins

features.name: Server-Side SDKs
features.notes: Pirsch: Go, Laravel. OpenPanel: Node, Python, PHP, Go, Rust

technical_comparison.title: Technical comparison
technical_comparison.intro: For developers evaluating analytics tools, here's the technical breakdown.

items.label: Open Source
items.notes: Pirsch core is open source under MIT license. SaaS features are proprietary.

items.label: Database
items.notes: Both use ClickHouse for analytics queries

pricing.title: Pricing comparison
pricing.intro: Pirsch offers affordable web analytics. OpenPanel adds a permanent free tier with all features.

openpanel.description: Simple pricing with 10,000 free events per month. All features included at every tier. Self-host for free with unlimited events.

competitor.description: Standard: $6/month for 10K pageviews, 50 websites. Plus: $12/month - unlimited websites, funnels, A/B testing. Enterprise: Custom pricing for on-premise and SSO. No free tier, just 30-day trial.

migration.title: Migrating from Pirsch to OpenPanel
migration.intro: Both use lightweight scripts and similar event tracking, making migration straightforward.

steps.title: Install OpenPanel SDK
steps.description: Add the OpenPanel SDK to your application. Both use lightweight scripts and server-side options.

steps.title: Map Events
steps.description: Pirsch events with metadata translate directly to OpenPanel's op.track() calls.

steps.title: Set Up User Identification (New)
steps.description: Unlike Pirsch, OpenPanel can identify users. Add op.identify() calls to unlock retention, cohorts, and user profiles.

steps.title: Configure Product Analytics (New)
steps.description: Set up retention reports, cohorts, and user journey analysis. Pirsch has basic funnels but not these features.

steps.title: Remove Pirsch Script
steps.description: Once verified, remove the Pirsch tracking script. Both are cookie-free so no consent changes needed.

sdk_compatibility.notes: Both use event-based tracking with simple APIs.

historical_data.notes: Most teams start fresh with OpenPanel and run both tools in parallel briefly.

use_cases.title: Where OpenPanel is a better fit than Pirsch
use_cases.intro: Choose OpenPanel when you need user-level analytics, free self-hosting, or a permanent free tier.

items.title: SaaS Products Needing User Analytics
items.description: Pirsch shows aggregate website traffic and basic funnels. If you need to understand individual user journeys, retention, and behavior within your product, OpenPanel adds these capabilities while staying privacy-friendly.

items.title: Teams Who Want Free Self-Hosting
items.description: Pirsch requires an Enterprise license with custom pricing for on-premise deployment. OpenPanel provides free self-hosting in a single Docker container with no restrictions.

items.title: Startups Needing a Free Tier
items.description: Pirsch has no free option - just a 30-day trial before requiring a $6/month subscription. OpenPanel offers 10,000 free events monthly, perfect for early-stage products.

items.title: Mobile App Analytics
items.description: Pirsch is designed for websites with a backend focus. OpenPanel offers native iOS, Android, and React Native SDKs with full product analytics capabilities.

items.title: Teams Needing Cohort & Retention Analysis
items.description: Pirsch's anonymous fingerprinting model doesn't support retention or cohort analysis. If understanding user behavior over time matters, OpenPanel provides these capabilities.

faqs.title: Frequently asked questions
faqs.intro: Common questions about switching from Pirsch to OpenPanel.

items.question: Is OpenPanel as privacy-friendly as Pirsch?
items.answer: Yes! Both are cookie-free by default and don't require consent banners. The key difference is that OpenPanel allows optional user identification for product analytics, while Pirsch uses anonymous fingerprinting. You control whether to identify users in OpenPanel.

items.question: Why switch from Pirsch to OpenPanel?
items.answer: Teams typically switch when they need: 1) Full product analytics (retention, cohorts, user profiles), 2) Free self-hosting without Enterprise pricing, 3) A permanent free tier, or 4) Native mobile SDKs. Pirsch excels at affordable web analytics but has limitations for product analytics.

items.question: Does Pirsch have a free tier?
items.answer: No. Pirsch offers a 30-day free trial, then requires a minimum $6/month subscription. OpenPanel provides 10,000 free events monthly with no time limit.

items.question: Can I self-host Pirsch for free?
items.answer: No. Pirsch self-hosting requires an Enterprise license with custom pricing. While the core library is open source (MIT), running the full SaaS requires a license. OpenPanel offers free self-hosting in a single Docker container.

items.question: Which has the smaller tracking script?
items.answer: OpenPanel's script is 2.3KB, while Pirsch's is about 4KB. Both are significantly smaller than Google Analytics (50KB+). Pirsch also emphasizes server-side integration which adds zero client-side weight.

items.question: Can Pirsch track mobile apps?
items.answer: Not natively. Pirsch is designed for web analytics with a backend/server-side focus. You could use their API, but there are no mobile-specific SDKs. OpenPanel offers native iOS, Android, and React Native SDKs.

items.question: What will I lose switching from Pirsch?
items.answer: Pirsch has a built-in URL shortener with tracking, Google Search Console integration in the dashboard, excellent white labeling options, and strong Go/backend integration. However, you'll gain full product analytics, free self-hosting, and mobile SDKs that Pirsch doesn't offer.

items.question: Is Pirsch or OpenPanel better for agencies?
items.answer: Pirsch has excellent agency features: extensive white labeling, custom domains, team management, and client access links. Their Plus plan at $12/month with unlimited websites is very affordable. However, if your clients need product analytics or you want free self-hosting, OpenPanel provides more value.
